senses.sense_definition: The unpredictable swerve of atoms, introduced as a concept by Lucretius to defend the atomistic doctrine of Epicurus.

examples.text: Lucretius proposed the <w>clinamen</w> to explain how free will could exist in a universe composed of falling atoms.
Without the unpredictable <w>clinamen</w>, the philosopher argued that atoms would never collide to create matter.
